snippet: Both James Blake, an internationally known former tennis star, and Angie, an 11-year-old student in the Bronx, found themselves thrown to the ground by a police officer. Then their cases diverge.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column highlights different treatment received by tennis star James Blake and 11-year-old Angie from the Bronx, both of whom were wrongly and violently arrested by New York City police officers; notes Mayor Bill de Blasio and Police Commissioner William J Bratton have both apologized to Blake, but Angie has heard nothing, despite fact that both encounters were caught on surveillance video.
lead_paragraph: Both James Blake, an internationally known former tennis star, and Angie, an 11-year-old student in the Bronx, found themselves thrown to the ground by a police officer. Then their cases diverge.

headline.print_headline: Misidentified and Tackled by the Police, but No Tennis Star Treatment
headline.main: Misidentified and Tackled by the New York Police, but No Tennis Star Treatment
